project.name: Tongyuan Technology Project - AI Lab Scoring System for Middle Schools
details: Proposed the basic framework of scoring algorithms and formulated 15 AI scoring standards that meet exam requirements based on the experimental norms and requirements of middle schools in Shenzhen, achieving AI scoring algorithms based on multi-channel video object and action recognition.

Responsible for developing the computer vision scoring algorithm based on the above scoring standards, achieving an object and action recognition-based scoring algorithm with an accuracy rate of over 90% in reliable recognition.

Maintained the computer vision recognition model database and the related preprocessing and postprocessing workflows for training data, using over 100,000 self-labeled images to train and optimize the model, achieving an accuracy rate of over 90% under laboratory lighting conditions.
Supported the successful deployment of the project at the Chongqing Education Equipment Exhibition and schools in Neijiang, Sichuan, and Inner Mongolia.

project.name: QinSheng Accompany - Digital Avatar APP based on Large Models
details: Collected image data of different virtual human figures and cleaned the images and labels to improve model learning quality.
Fine-tuned the parameters of the Stable Diffusion model to train the LORA model for user-defined figures.
Used text-to-speech technology to generate voice information from text information generated by large model API interfaces.
Implemented basic matching of lip movements and voice output of virtual humans in images based on deep learning models, achieving low-latency human-machine conversation on the A800 server.
Participated in the company's internal project annual roadshow and was responsible for the overall introduction and demonstration of the product.

project.name: Smart Street Light Precision Operation and Maintenance Project
details: Processed and analyzed daily data of more than 10,000 smart street lights.
Used machine learning and deep learning algorithms such as LSTM and decision trees for fault prediction, achieving an accuracy rate of over 90%.
Built a complete data cleaning, analysis, modeling, and prediction process for multi-model collaboration, achieving real-time update and monitoring of street light information daily.

project.name: Desktop Organizing Robot Arm
details: Improved the gripper and base design of the WidowX 200 robotic arm and created the URDF model.
Developed Socket programs to enable communication between the robot and the PyBullet simulator for synchronized operation in simulated and real environments.

Wrote Python scripts to collect over 100,000 images of blocks with different shapes, quantities, and poses on the desktop, and processed the images using the OpenCV library to meet the data requirements of deep learning.
Modified and trained the yolov7 and Resnet models to accurately identify different poses and numbers of LEGO blocks in an image for planning the robot arm's grasping path.
Designed a small neural network with Cartesian control to improve the operating accuracy of the robot arm in the real environment, significantly improving the grasping accuracy of the robot arm.
Worked with the mentor to be interviewed by The New York Times, responsible for introducing the robot arm project and demonstrating the robot arm movement process.

project.name: Quadruped Self-Model Robot
details: Developed Python scripts to automatically generate different robot models and checked whether the generated robot models could stand and walk.
Used genetic algorithms to study the gait of robots with different shapes and explored the movement forms of robots under different terrain friction.
Improved the internal circuit design of the robot to solve the overheating problem of servo motors.
Used Domain Randomization to reduce the gap between the simulator and reality and successfully instructed the physical robot to complete actual walking.
Developed Socket programs to enable communication between the robot and the IMU and computer, collected gait data of the physical robot, and used it for neural network training.

project.name: Bipedal Rabbit Robot
details: Designed the 3D model of the robot using SolidWorks, assembled the circuits and robot after 3D printing, and tested its gait stability and energy consumption.

Built the model of the robot in the PyBullet simulator, optimized its gait using machine learning, and used Raspberry Pi to connect with the computer host for remote control, increasing the robot's walking speed from 3cm/s to 15cm/s.

project_experience.from: Course: Machine Design, University of California Los Angeles

project.name: Fully Automated Wardrobe Robot
details: Designed the wardrobe robot model that can carry clothes of different weights and styles using SolidWorks.
Designed a gear mechanism that can drive four mechanical linkages for handling clothes using only one motor, achieving the function of storing and delivering clothes.
Simulated the structural force of the robot using SolidWorks simulation system and adjusted the design according to the simulation results.

project.name: Remote Control Airplane Model
details: Used SolidWorks to simulate the aerodynamics around the wing to optimize the plane's design.
Tested different wing specifications and designs; defined the scale of test results, supervised and tested the entire process, and eventually improved the overall avionics performance.
Built airplane parts using 3D printing, laser cutting, CNC machining, etc., and participated in the assembly of the airplane.

Participated in the testing of the rope robot, provided technical advice, and documented the testing process and results.

Designed tour projects within the museum and created maps and tour brochures using Autocad and Photoshop.
Led more than 20 children participating in summer camp activities to build traditional Chinese buildings and vehicles (Shamian historical buildings and Guangzhou shipbuilding) using LEGO.
